meanings.definition: Not conforming to the classical style or tradition.
meanings.sent1: Her unclassical outfit stood out among the elegant gowns at the ball.
meanings.sent2: The painting's unclassical approach sparked a lively debate among art critics.
meanings.sent3: Despite the unclassical mix of colors, the room had a cozy and inviting feel.
meanings.sent4: His unclassical interpretation of the sonnet breathed new life into the old poem.
meanings.sent5: The unclassical architecture of the building was both striking and unconventional.

meanings.definition: Not characteristic of or adhering to classical principles or standards.
meanings.sent1: The unclassical music genre blended modern beats with traditional instruments.
meanings.sent2: Her unclassical approach to cooking often resulted in unique and delicious dishes.
meanings.sent3: The unclassical behavior of the cat chasing its tail amused the children.
meanings.sent4: His unclassical taste in art favored bold and experimental pieces.
meanings.sent5: The unclassical design of the car challenged the norms of automotive engineering.
